name: PCUS formed from PCUSA
description: Separation amid disputes over slavery, politics, and theology during Civil War tensions.

name: OPC separated from PCUSA
description: Conservative members separated over liberal/modernist theology in the Fundamentalist-Modernist controversy.

name: PCA separated from PCUS
description: Congregations separated amid concerns over perceived theological liberalism, including disputes about the authority and inerrancy of Scripture and the deity of Christ.

name: UPCUSA formed by merger
description: Union of PCUSA and UPCNA driven by ecumenical efforts and reunion of long-separated branches.

name: PC(USA) formed by merger
description: Reunion of the northern and southern Presbyterian branches into PC(USA).
